reviews.text: We were impressed by this hotel from the website - booked using Neilson, but chose to get independent taxi from the airport rather than the Neilson one - we saved >100 euro, but Neilson listened (well done!) and now have a cheaper company.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.text: Food choices great - perhaps a bit crowded selection area ... but meals served to dinners were good. We didn't like the jugs of coffee for breakfast and asked for cappucino, and found out at the end of the week that we DIDN'T have to pay extra for this! We did have to pay for it with evening meals though.
reviews.title: STILL THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Family suites spacious and clean and a good view.
reviews.title: If you have kids you will love this place,.....

reviews.text: Swimming pools good - choice of indoors and outdoors - connected. No children in spa area.
reviews.title: THE GEM

reviews.text: We aim to be back to ski from here - the summer facilities are great: the adventure park can be challenging for all ages and loads of good walks
reviews.title: Good located near the lift and slopes, very good kids club, and food is super.

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at the last minute as our original hotel cancelled due to early closure. Very convenient from Salzburg Airport, about 1 hour 20 min straight motorway until the last 6 miles up the mountain. Spacious modern rooms but would advise you to book the Royal Rooms in the main building as the Classic Rooms are in an annexe and apparently quite old fashioned and dark. Ski hire and ski school very convenient in building. Slopes accross the road. Unfortunately we came at the end of the season and the snow was not very good anymore but apparently they had very little snowfall this winter anyhow.Normally beginning of April is apprently still good. Fantastic pool and spa area although view to beautiful landscape is obstructed by hideaously ugly apartment blocks!! Food very good. A negative is that we found the staff to be quite inpersonal and unfriendly. We have always stayed in family owned hotels on skiing holidays in Austria and the staff is a lot friendlier. Especailly the restaurant staff was quite unfriendly. One very irritating thing was that the plate was taken away from you as soon as you put your cutley down, before the others at the table had finished their meal which is not correct.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

reviews.text: Very good for skiiers but as there is no village there is not much to do if you are accompanying and don't ski. No internet access in the rooms which is unusual for this kind of hotel.
reviews.title: This could have been perfect!

reviews.text: We spent a wonderful week at this family mountain resort and we were baffled at the great features and the overall fantastic service offered. I think at around 200€ per night this was also a great deal, then again, summer season is different from winter. We have vacationed in Kärnten in summer before, this spot does not seem to be a summer / hiking hot spot (chairlifts open only on certain days.)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but a few issues

reviews.text: - Fantastic room. I had booked the Cristallo family room which is the best in terms of layout I have encountered so far. When traveling with family, it is sometimes hard to get some 'alone time', thanks to many sliding doors, this place can be configured any way you want. Some neat design tricks, like an LDC TV the can be flipped through the wall to be available in either the bedroom or the living room, or tiny details like a power outlet IN the safe (you can charge your laptop while it is secure) are strokes of genius.
reviews.title: Fantastic stress free ski holiday

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with my sister in March this year and it is great. It is right on the slopes and you can ski to within 20 feet of the boot room. It has a spa and relasxation room, a gym etc etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, good location, great food!

reviews.text: It is great for families and plenty for young children to do.
reviews.title: A perfect child friendly base for skiing

reviews.text: The food was wonderful with loads of choice.
reviews.title: Perfect family place

likes.disliked: — that we had to eventually go

reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel which we stayed at for a weeks skiing with our 6 year old son. There are two parts to the hotel, the modern building with the spa, pools (yes two pools - more later) and the restaurant & bar. There is also an older building linked by corridor which contains more appartment style rooms. We stayed in the older wing and this was in very good condition and we had a room with bedroom and lounge/kitchenette with sofa be & dining table and balconies in both. If we went again we might try to stay in the main hotel but only as it is a walk to the older wing. The facilities here are excellent, a spa with loads of tratments, exercise room, quiet room on the top floor with great views, a spa pool which goes outside - my son loved being in a warm pool in the snow! There is actually another full kids pool with a slide, its own sauna and changing rooms and adjoining nursery area. The food was excellent and the service professional & friendly. The hotel has its own ski shop & ski room which exits right to the nursery slopes just accross the road. The hotel is great for families as the ski school brings your children back to the nursery club where they are looked after until you arrive. A year has gone by since we stayed there, I am adding this review as I just haven't found a skiing holiday this year that looks a patch on this, unfortunately the word ahs gogt round and this hotel is very busy!!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: I have visited this hotel often over the last few years and I have to say I have never been disappointed. In fact, if anything it gets better. I have used the hotel as an individual and as a guest of a package tour company and found no difference to the warm welcome or the quality of service. Arriving last week at the peak of a Saturday change over period we were checked into our rooms within 10 minutes of our arrival with friendly smiles.
reviews.title: Second Home

reviews.text: Welcome drinks were provided on the first evening with our dinner after individual personal greeting by the Hotel Manager or the restaurant Manager.
reviews.title: Ideal for family skiing week

reviews.text: The restraurant is split into many smaller areas, enabling differing family types to be accomodated.
reviews.title: The first family trip and we will never forget it, it was soooo good!
An ideal family place
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly sited for all levels of skier on the slope with its own ski hire and ski school, it has child care facility for those who need it with a seperate smaller child pool etc. for their sole use.
Having read the previous reviews anything else I write would only in the main be duplication.
reviews.title: Super for family holidays
